data.title: Additive blending doesn't work with the Cg Renderer.

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.title: Muzzle drawing issue
data.body:
It appears that muzzle flashes need very high Tick values for the first frame to show up at all, and even that doesn't help consistently (and it degrades how fluent the animation looks).

For example, if the muzzle has only 1 frame as in d2k, A tick value of 160 makes it show up roughly every second shot. At default it doesn't show at all.

The new muzzle in RA/C&C mod doesn't seem to display the first frame every time either, very rarely frame 2 appears to be skipped as well. Strangely enough this doesn't seem to affect frame 3+.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/820627-muzzle-drawing-issue?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed NukeLaunch sounds and missing icon sequences
data.body:
Found a mix of typos and not implemented stuff for nuclear missile launch sounds and announcements. Tried to do my best to resolve it.

This also fixes a crash when NOD orders vehicles which is kinda important. A typo I just recently introduced when migrating C&C to load icons from sequences.


data.title: Restore the native mouse cursor before showing the crash dialog

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
When running in pseudo-fullscreen on OSX the crash dialog will show in front of the window, but the mouse cursor is hidden making it unuseable.

We should be calling `Sdl.SDL_ShowCursor(1)` at an appropriate time before displaying the dialog to tell the OS to restore the native mouse cursor.

data.title: The build palette isn't big enough to display all buildings of all factions
data.body:
The Build Palette isn't big enough to display all possible builidngs (after enabling "Build Everything" in the Cheats menu).

What about adding extra tabs, one for each faction : 

![build_evertything_tabs](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/982413/6ba36318-07ed-11e3-9c6b-c1e26c4e98dc.png)

This way, it would be possible to filter the buildings.

Here are the logos (PNG):
![build_evertything_tabs2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/982430/2bf5694e-07ef-11e3-884b-9e1c8bae5bcb.png)

data.title: ColorMixerWidget still isn't threadsafe

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
Noticed with Playtest 20130818.

A Fatal error message appeared, and OpenRA didn't crash until I closed the small error message window.

Here is my exception.log file: 

Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Bitmap region is already locked.
   at System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits(Rectangle rect, ImageLockMode flags, PixelFormat format, BitmapData bitmapData)
   at System.Drawing.Bitmap.LockBits(Rectangle rect, ImageLockMode flags, PixelFormat format)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.ColorMixerWidget.GenerateBitmapWorker()
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart_Context(Object state)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state)
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart()

```
Exception of type `System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException`: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
Inner Exception of type `System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException`: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation.
  Inner Exception of type `System.NullReferenceException`: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
      at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.Widgets.Logic.CncConquestObjectivesLogic..ctor (OpenRA.Widgets.Widget widget, OpenRA.World world) [0x0021a] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Cnc//Widgets/Logic/CncConquestObjectivesLogic.cs:61 
```

`LobbyInfo.ClientWithIndex()` fails since the client is gone. The original code used the PlayerReference to avoid this.

data.title: Add crash dialog
Palette should be defineable per sequence
data.body:
TS uses palette.pal for pips, anim.pal for most other animations and unit***.pal for water explosions (and some other animations, I think).

While this can in theory be worked around by converting all these special cases to one palette, those conversions often lead to a slight loss in quality and more bloat in the bits folder.

I think it should be possible to define a palette for each sequence, instead of hard-coding explosions to use the 'effect' palette, for example. Additionally, this would make it easier for modders to add animations to any mod from other 2D C&C games without the need to convert them first.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/819321-palette-should-be-defineable-per-sequence?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added the vehicle hijacker
data.body: This is @ScottNZ's initial implementation discussed at #3272 rebased and I added owner checks to HackyAI.CleanSquads() and friends. Also brought back the Dune 2000 Deviator tank because this should work now.

data.body: The mod crashes without it if FOW is disabled.

data.title: No OpenRA.Mod.TS.dll in mod folder after compiling
data.body:
Might be something on my end.
I use Win7 x64, compiling via MSBuild command line (batch file).

OpenRA basically compiles just fine, however OpenRA.Mod.TS.dll does not automatically get copied to the TS mod folder. Only happens with the TS dll.

Request: Ore Trucks prioritize gems.
data.body:
Would be nice if Ore Trucks would prioritize gems over ore. Like when there is an ore field with a few gems in it, they would harvest the gems before going after the regular ore.

data.title: TileSet Refactoring
data.body:
This gives some much needed improvements:
- Support for additional tile formats (.R8 as part of this pr, TS/RA2 .tmp in the future).
- More efficient use of texture space.
- Support for the ingame map editor.

data.title: Add engine support for D2K explosions
data.body:
This exposes a BlendMode sequence property, which will allow #3676 to properly render the D2K explosions.

![explosions](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/167819/959932/3cafbfd0-049f-11e3-8800-a42814b9c0af.png)

data.title: Smart Infantry Units : they could move to let the player install a building
data.body:
What about infantry units that automatically move if the player tries to install a building where they are standing ?

It would just be a short move, just to let the building being placed.

data.title: Added WithIdleOverlay Render Trait
data.body: This does the easiest yet most common variant of #2211. It will help me complete setup the Tiberian Sun buildings properly and is also required for Dune 2000. I did not clean up and finish the d2k mod overlays yet because @pchote blocked #3676 and I won't do all the manual overlay offset tweaking twice.

data.title: Launch angle for missiles
data.body: Currently only bullet has it.

data.title: Made team basewalking a lobby switch
data.body: As requested in #2464 / #3261. This workarounds the issue that this is controversial balance wise. You get a switch to decide for yourself now.

data.title: Non-controversial early merge cleanups from the native-r8s branch
data.body: The smaller cleanups hiding inside of #3676 that don't really touch much.
